alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Jefferson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 4:05PM CDT until July 14 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN DOUGLAS AND SOUTHERN JEFFERSON COUNTIES... At 403 PM CDT, Emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Perry with 10 inches of water over roads. Water is also over roads in Lawrence. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.25 to 0.75 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lawrence, Oskaloosa, Perry, McLouth, Ozawkie, Lecompton and Williamstown. This includes the following highways... Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 189 and 205. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-0.75 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
